title: Reflection - mirror 1 at angle theta 0 to mirror 2

content.question: Two flat mirrors, Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are located near each other, as shown in the figure. Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is oriented at an angle <math alttext="theta sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from the horizontal, while Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is oriented horizontally. A beam of light is incident on Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, making the same angle <math alttext="theta sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from the normal to the surface of the mirror. The beam reflects from Mirror <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> toward Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and then reflects from Mirror <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following relations is true regarding the angles of reflection <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>and <math alttext="theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> as measured between the normal to each respective mirror's surface and the beam from mirrors <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="theta sub 1 equals theta sub 2, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, theta sub 1 equals theta sub 2, close parenthesis, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="theta sub 1 is greater than, open parenthesis, theta sub 2 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="theta sub 1 is greater than theta sub 2, which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="theta sub 1 is greater than, open parenthesis, theta sub 2 equals 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>
